info.title: SevenRooms Reservations API
info.description:
The SevenRooms Reservations API is a RESTful API over HTTPS that utilizes JSON as the data response format. It allows application developers to query for data and perform actions, such as booking a reservation or looking up client data.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

post.description: Create an API Authorization Token for making requests to the SevenRooms Reservations API.

200.description: JSON object containing an Authorization token that expires after 24 hours.

msg.description: Humanâ€readable message describing the response status.

token.description: Authentication token required to fulfill requests. Expires after 24 hours.

token_expiration_datetime.description: Date/Time when the token will expire

get.description: Fetch a venue by ID.

200.description:
Venue object

**WARNING: The SevenRooms Reservations API is a dynamic JSON API, any response field may contain a null value.**

country.description: The country of the Client's residential address.

external_venue_id.description:
Unique identifier in an external system for a Venue.      
> You may specify your own identifiers for Venues for various reference purposes in your own systems.

internal_name.description: Venue internally-facing name that users will see when using SevenRooms, primarily for use when differentially similarly-named venues in different locations

phone_number.description:
Phone number associated with the Reservation.      
> Can be numerous valid formats, including international phone      
numbers. US phone numbers generally follow      
1-xxx-xxx-xxxx.

postal_code.description: `postal_code` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation.

state.description: `state` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation.

unique_confirmation_prefix.description: Unique prefix for a Venue's reservation within it's Venue Group

venue_group_id.description: Unique identifier of the venue group.

data.policy: Thank you for your reservation. Should your plans change, please let us know 24 hours before your reservation time. We look forward to serving you.
data.name: Annie's

get.description: Retrieve a venue's availability.

200.description:
JSON list of Availability objects per shift. Each shift contains a `times` property with per time slot availability for the specified Venue.

**WARNING: The SevenRooms Reservations API is a dynamic JSON API, any response field may contain a null value.**


Time Slot Types
----------------
| Type | Description |
|-------|---------------- |
| book | Time slot is available for booking. |
| request | Time slot is accepting reservation requests. The responses with type=request mean that there is no availability for that time slot and is a request only. If the returned time slot is a type=request, this means that the venue is only accepting reservation requests at that time.|

shift_persistent_id.description:
Unique identifier of the Shift belonging to this Reservation.      
> Concatenation of:      
> - Venue ID      
> - Shift Category      
> - Timestamp when shift was created      
>       
> Note that Venue ID may contain dashes.

access_persistent_id.description:
Unique identifier for access as a result of the availability call for the given time slot.      

Access persistent ID from result of availability call for given time slot.

duration.description: The amount of time, in minutes, for the Reservation.

times.cancellation_policy: If you REALLY want to cancel a reservation do it exactly 24 hours prior. For no shows or late cancellations, you will be subject to fee of $0.25 per person, plus a $2,500 annoyance fee that will be applied to the credit card on file. Payable in your local currency or organs.
times.policy: Don't be a jerk. Let us know when you're going to cancel like a day before. Otherwise we will find you and we will drag you to your reservation.

get.description: Retrieve a specified Reservation.

200.description:
Object containing identifiers for the created Reservation object.

**WARNING: The SevenRooms Reservations API is a dynamic JSON API, any response field may contain a null value.**

access_persistent_id.description:
Unique identifier for access as a result of the availability call for the given time slot.      

Access persistent ID from result of availability call for given time slot.

arrival_time.description:
Local time for the Reservation.      
> Times begin at 6AM. Any time considered the next day, e.g. 2AM will still be considered the same evening.

arrived_guests.description: Number of people that actually arrived for the Reservation.

booked_by.description: Client who will be accredited for booking the Reservation.

check_numbers.description:
Check numbers for the Reservation.      

> Comma-delimited value, entered free form or populated via POS integration.

city.description: The city of the Client's residential address.

client_id.description: Unique identifier of the Client profile

client_requests.description: Requests supplied by guests at the time of booking for the Reservation.

comps.description:
Amount comp'd on this Reservation.      

> Stored as      
  currency of the Venue's location.

comps_price_type.description:
The type of comp provided to the Reservation.      

> Can be one of:      
>       
> - dollar      
> - bottle

cost_option.description:
Bitfield for one of the following values:      

  - Fee Dollars      
  - Minimum Dollars      
  - Minimum Bottles      
  - Comp      
  - No Min

country.description: The country of the Client's residential address.

duration.description: The amount of time, in minutes, for the Reservation.

email.description:
Email associated with the Reservation.      
> All emails are validated for format prior to entry into the system.

external_client_id.description:
Client or Customer ID of the external system that      
booked this Reservation, if applicable.      

> If the Reservation was imported as part of a booking channel integration, e.g. Google Reserve, this field will be populated with the customer ID from that channel.

external_id.description:
ID for 3rd party foreign key to this reservation      

> You may specify your own identifiers for Reservations that you book via the API for various reference purposes in your own systems.

external_reference_code.description:
The reference or confirmation number of the external system      
that booked this Reservation, if applicable

external_user_id.description:
Third party User ID stored on the Client profile.      

> You may associate an external user account with a Client in the SevenRooms database. If the associated client for the Reservation has an `external_user_id` then that value will be returned here.

is_vip.description: VIP status of the Client booking the Reservation.

last_name.example: Last name of the Client booking the Reservation.

left_time.description: Local time the party left the Venue.

loyalty_id.example: `loyalty_id` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation.

loyalty_tier.description: `loyalty_tier` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation..

max_guests.description: Number of people expected for the Reservation.

mf_ratio_female.description: Number of females expected for the Reservation.

mf_ratio_male.description: Number of males expected for the Reservation.

min_price.description: Minimum price required for the Reservation.

modify_reservation_link.description: Link for client to modify a reservation

notes.description: Internal, Venue facing notes for the Reservation.

onsite_payment.description:
Net spend before gratuity and taxes for the Reservation.      
> Stored as currency of the Venue's location.

paid_by.description:
Full name of Client that paid for the Reservation.      
> Entered free form.

phone_number.description:
Phone number associated with the Reservation.      
> Can be numerous valid formats, including international phone      
numbers. US phone numbers generally follow      
1-xxx-xxx-xxxx.

pos_tickets.description: JSON dictionary of Check information, including spend information and items ordered.

postal_code.description: `postal_code` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation.

prepayment.description:
Prepayments for the Reservation.      
> Stored as currency of the Venue's location.

reference_code.description:
Guest facing Reservation number. Uniqueness      
is scoped to a Venue. If Venue prefixes are turned on,      
uniqueness is scoped to the Venue Group level.

reservation_sms_opt_in.description: Show opt-in for receiving SMS about reservations

reservation_type.description: Comma-delimited list of Reservation tag names.

seated_time.description: Local time the party was seated at the Venue.

send_reminder_email.description: If True, an email is sent to remind the guest of their reservation.

send_reminder_sms.description: If True, a SMS is sent to remind the guest of their reservation.

served_by.description: Full name of the server for the Reservation.

hotel_confirmation.description: Confirmation code for the hotel (if applicable)

hotel_room.description: Room at hotel (if applicable and available)

shift_persistent_id.description:
Unique identifier of the Shift belonging to this Reservation.      
> Concatenation of:      
> - Venue ID      
> - Shift Category      
> - Timestamp when shift was created      
>       
> Note that Venue ID may contain dashes.

source_client_id.description:
Foreign key to a source Client entity.      
> The optional source client parameter refers to the client who booked the Reservation on behalf of guest, e.g. Concierge or Assistant.

state.description: `state` value from the Client entity associated with the Reservation.

status.description:
Status of the Reservation.      

For more information please see the guide on Reservation Statuses [here](https://api-docs.sevenrooms.com/guides/reservation-statuses).      
  
> Customizable per Venue. Default statuses include:      
> - NOT_RECONCILED      
> - NO_ENTRY      
> - NO_SHOW      
> - CANCELED      
> - LEFT_MESSAGE      
> - WRONG_NUMBER      
> - CONFIRMED      
> - PRE_ARRIVED      
> - PRE_PARTIALLY_ARRIVED      
> - ARRIVED       
> - ARRIVED_PARTIAL      
> - LATE      
> - 1ST_COURSE      
> - 2ND_COURSE      
> - 3RD_COURSE      
> - DESSERT      
> - CHECK_DROPPED      
> - PAID      
> - BUS_TABLE      
> - COMPLETE

status_display.description:
Venue-configured display value for the status database      
values.      
      
For more information please see the guide on Reservation Statuses [here](https://api-docs.sevenrooms.com/guides/reservation-statuses).      

> Configurable in Venue settings.

status_simple.description:
A value of one of the following statuses:      
- Incomplete      
- Complete      
- Canceled      
- No Show      
- No Entry      
      
For more information please see the guide on Reservation Statuses [here](https://api-docs.sevenrooms.com/guides/reservation-statuses).      
      
> Canceled, No Show, and No Entry are specifically      
called out. All other pre-service statuses (e.g.      
Booked, Left Message) are valued as Incomplete. Any inservice      
status (e.g. Seated, Left) is valued as Complete. Subject to future additions.

table_numbers.description: Comma-delimited table numbers for the Reservation.

total_payment.description: Sum of `prepayment` and `onsite_payment` for the Reservation.

user.description: The SevenRooms User who created the Reservation.

venue_group_client_id.description: Foreign key to a Venue Group client entity.

venue_group_id.description: Unique identifier of the venue group.

venue_seating_area_id.description: The id of the seating area.  This attribute will be populated once the table has been assigned

venue_seating_area_name.description: The name of the seating area.  This attribute will be populated once the table has been assigned

auto_assignments.description: Information about the Reservation's auto-assigned table(s).

table_codes.description: One or more table codes auto-assigned to this Reservation.

sort_order.description: The tables sort order as configured in the SevenRooms Web Portal.

name.description: The name of the guest auto-assigned to the table(s).

table_ids.description: One or more unique table IDs auto-assigned to this Reservation.

is_reassigned.description: Whether or not the auto-assignment was later reassigned to a different table when the guest was seated.

problems.description: Information regarding any problems that exist because of the Reservation's table assignment.

post.summary: Bulk Reservation Status and Table Update
post.description:
Pass in a json payload in the body with a list of reservations you would like to update.

For each reservation, you need to have a `reservation_id` and the fields you would like to update.

You can update up to 200 reservations per API call. If you want to play it safe, batch it as 50 or 100 reservations per API call.

200.description: Successful Reservation Update (All)

client_id.description: Unique identifier of the Client profile

get.description: Retrieve Availability for a specified Venue Group.

200.description:
JSON list of Availability objects per shift. Each shift contains a `times` property with per time slot availability for each Venue in the Venue Group (optionally filtered by municipality).

**WARNING: The SevenRooms Reservations API is a dynamic JSON API, any response field may contain a null value.**

Time Slot Types
----------------
| Type | Description |
|-------|---------------- |
| book | Time slot is available for booking. |
| request | Time slot is accepting reservation requests. |

limit.description: Limit on objects returned between 1 and 400. Default is 30.

Unique identifier of the Shift belonging to this Reservation.      
> Concatenation of:      
> - Venue ID      
> - Shift Category      
> - Timestamp when shift was created      
>       
> Note that Venue ID may contain dashes.

access_persistent_id.description:
Unique identifier for access as a result of the availability call for the given time slot.      

Access persistent ID from result of availability call for given time slot.

duration.description: The amount of time, in minutes, for the Reservation.

times.cancellation_policy: If you REALLY want to cancel a reservation do it exactly 24 hours prior. For no shows or late cancellations, you will be subject to fee of $0.25 per person, plus a $2,500 annoyance fee that will be applied to the credit card on file. Payable in your local currency or organs.

post.description:
Combines multiple client profiles into a single profile. Takes one "winning" client_id, and one or more "losing" client_id(s). Details of the losing profile(s) will be added to the winning profile. The winning client_id will remain, and the losing client_id(s) will be deleted after the merge is complete.
Billing History, Profile Stats, Tags and Marketing History will be combined. For all other data fields the winning profile data will remain and the losing profile data will be deleted immediately. NOTE: THIS PROCESS CANNOT BE UNDONE.

post.description: Add charge information for a charge conducted outside of the system. The `reservation_id` path parameter provided in the request may either be the Reservation's `reservation_id` or the Reservation's `reference_code`. Note that reference codes are only unique to a single venue unless venue prefixes are enabled for a Venue Group. If the Reservation's `reference_code` is provided as the path parameter, a `venue_id` parameter is required.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The `cursor` field can be used to get multiple pages based on the limit (max of 400). post.description:
The `/begin_payment` endpoint is used when a customer is in the middle of the booking process that requires a prepayment guarantee.
The `/begin_payment` endpoint will create the PaymentIntent on Stripe and fetches the PaymentIntent id and client_secret to be used together with your Stripe Publishable Key on the  moment of generating the credit card form using the Stripe SDK.

200.description: Object containing the setup intent information.

post.description:
The `begin_save` endpoint is used when a booking requires a credit card guarantee (save cared for later).  
The `begin_save` is used to  create the SetupIntent on Stripe and fetches the SetupIntent id and client_secret to be used together with SevenRooms Stripe Publishable Key to be used generating the credit card form using the Stripe SDK.

(Legacy) upgrade_categories.description:
**Note: You no longer need to include this to include upgrades with your reservation however you will not get an error if you do.**  

Create a Reservation with Upgrades using a comma-delimited list 

`upgrade_category_ids`. 

> Ex. `{"<upgrade_category_id>":{"is_charging_gratuity":false}, "<upgrade_category_id>":{is_charging_tax":false}}`

bypass_availability.description:
**Note: Defaults to true if is_walkin set to true.**      
      
This parameter will bypass availability (he access rule could have no tables or pacing left) during the creation of the reservation.  This is to support import use cases      
      
The reservation will still be attached to the access rule based on shift and time so that the access rule seating areas and reservation tags would still auto-apply.

bypass_required_contact_fields.description:
**Note: Defaults to true if bypass_availability set to true.**      

> If **True**, skips the validation for the venue settings of **"When reservations are booked, require certain fields to be entered."**

bypass_duplicate_reservation_check.description:
**Note: Defaults to true if bypass_availability set to true.**      

> If **True**, skips the validation for the venue setting of **"Allow a guest to have multiple reservations booked on the same shift"**

bypass_editable_cutoff.description:
**Note: Defaults to true if bypass_availability set to true.**      

> If **True**, skips the validation for the access rule setting of **"Reservation cannot be modified after the cancellation cut-off time"**

mf_ratio_male.description: Number of males expected for the Reservation.

mf_ratio_female.description: Number of females expected for the Reservation.

cursor_query_optional.description:
The `cursor` field can be used to get multiple pages based on the limit (max of 400). If there are more than the limit of results then the response will include the field `cursor`. 

The subsequent call will include the cursor field and SevenRooms responds with the next iteration of results and so on.

active_query_optional.name: active
active_query_optional.description:
Use this parameter to filter venues within the Venue Group based on their "Active/Inactive" status in SevenRooms. 

When set to "`true`" this endpoint retrieves **only** active venues, which, by definition, are actively performing VMS operations. 

Additionally, when "`true`" inactive venues are excluded from the results as they no longer engage in VMS operations.

client_sort_order_query_optional.name: sort_order
client_sort_order_query_optional.description:
Value by which to sort response objects. >`last_updated_ascending` - Results sorted by last updated in ascending order (oldest first) >`last_updated_descending` - Results sorted by last updated in descending order (most recent first) >`name_lower_last_first` - Results sorted by last name first (A-Z a-z) >`-name_lower_last_first` - Results sorted by last name first descending (Z-A)
*Please Note: Last names beginning with lower case letters will be present after names beginning with "Z", so these names will be present first in this sort order. (z-a Z-A)* >`date` - Results sorted by date ascending >`-date` - Results sorted by date descending >`final_bill` - Results sorted by lowest `total_net_payment` >`-final_bill` - Results sorted by highest `total_net_payment`
